column4: I just reinstalled Windows and overwrote GRUB - I tried reinstalling grub to the MBR and now when I boot I can see my old grub items, but none of them will boot
what does error 22 mean? do you know?
ok. what that means is that your menu.lst is likely pointing to the wrong partition
what does your /boot/grub/menu.lst say for your root?
Let me mount the partition real quick
I think I found the problem. It's pointing to (hd0,3) for some reason. It should be 0,1
what do you think happened? did you alter any partitions when you re-installed windows?
huh. wonder why it was pointing to (hd0,3) then...
Dunno. I'm on the same system I'm working on though, so I'll restart and see if it works - thanks for the help
Well now I'm booted into my drive, but my X server has magically stopped working
Yeah. My monitor goes into standby on VT7
check to see if your video card has jumped PCI ids or something, or if it has the right pci id in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf
